configuration.stem: Which of the methods below would be most effective if a pepper plant farmer wants to maintain the current level of capsaicin in a particular variety of pepper? Select all that apply.

feedBack.firstWrongHint: Genetic and environmental factors can affect the amount of capsaicin produced by a pepper plant.
feedBack.finalWrongHint: The farmer should control all environmental conditions and prevent cross-breeding with other plants.

options.name: mc-opt-item-028151441155932844
options.text: The farmer cross pollinates the plant variety with pollen from another variety of pepper plant.

options.name: mc-opt-item-06761015402153134x1
options.text: The farmer carefully controls water, sunlight, and other environmental conditions that affect the growth of the pepper plants.

options.name: _widget_-0385266541185292
options.text: The farmer hand-pollinates the plant by transferring pollen from one flower on the plant to another flower on the same plant.

options.name: _widget_-023382238237696518
options.text: The farmer controls the amount of water but varies the amount of sunlight the plants receive.
